metadata.title: CVE-2019-14452 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Sigil before 0.9.16 is vulnerable to a directory traversal, allowingattackers to write arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in a ZIParchive entry that is mishandled during extraction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14452` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sigil - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
sigil-data - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sigil package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
